messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory]
messages.msgSnippet: Tony- (or anybody else who might know) Yes, the Kaga was obviously named after the province, but what about other aircraft carriers? Any idea as to the
messages.messageBody:
Tony- (or anybody else who might know)

Yes, the Kaga was obviously named after the province,
but what about other aircraft carriers? Any idea as to
the Shokaku, Zuikaku, Shoho, Zuiho, Soryu, Hiryu,
Akagi?

I don't recognize any of the words...

Thanks,
Nate

--- "Anthony J. Bryant" <ajbryant@...> wrote:
> O'Keefe wrote:
>
> > Hi. The japanese Navy had a series of battle ships
> named Musashi. were they named after the famed
> swordsman or the province in Japan? Thanks
> >
>
> The province. Look at other battleships, it's always
> a province. Kaga, Yamato, Musashi, etc.
>
> For the record, "Musashi" wasn't his name, anyway.
>
> Tony
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory]
messages.msgSnippet: ... The province. Look at other battleships, it s always a province. Kaga, Yamato, Musashi, etc. For the record, Musashi wasn t his name, anyway. Tony
messages.messageBody:
O'Keefe wrote:

> Hi. The japanese Navy had a series of battle ships named Musashi. were they named after the famed swordsman or the province in Japan? Thanks
>

The province. Look at other battleships, it's always a province. Kaga, Yamato, Musashi, etc.

For the record, "Musashi" wasn't his name, anyway.

Tony
